textos: Arriving in Miami at an early age to pursue their musical dream, frontmen Ivan Lotus and Samuel Little quickly made
new friends in The Magic City. ¬†Musical prodigies Julian Bermudez and Marcelo Romero joined the band with years of jazz experience alongside virtuoso drummer Marvin Clairsaint.

In 2025, the band recorded their first album titled "Where is Edgar?" produced by Jos√© Luis "Cheo" Pardo‚Äîfounder, producer, and former member of Los Amigos Invisibles. The album contains songs such as "CALIENTE" and "Paraiso" that mark a fresh new chapter and define the next era of Lotus Collective.
But it doesn‚Äôt end here! The band is already working on a new EP, set to be released in 2026. Meanwhile, we still don‚Äôt know where Edgar is‚Äîplease help us find him!
Like the lotus flower, the Lotus Collective grows despite its circumstances and believes in always expressing itself in a unique way. In their case, using music as a transformative medium
The Lotus Collective hand-selected artists from diverse countries and cultural backgrounds to bring a signature, unified sound that represents the essence of Miami, the city they love.

secciones.texto: IN the lotus house, this room is the GALLERY ü™∑
cheo+ lotus collective at zey zey
Nights at lagniappe
Gozadera social club
recording "where is edgar?"
Have you been to the Lotus House? That‚Äôs where we jam and keep some of our best performances.

textos: 2025 was a year that felt like el Para√≠so. On May 9th, we had the opportunity to open for Jos√© Luis 'Cheo' Pardo at Zey Zey‚Äîa mind and soul who had always been one of our greatest inspirations as musicians and who came full circle by joining us as the producer and mentor behind our first album, Where Is Edgar?
We played in countless bars and restaurants around the city, yet the shows at Lagniappe and Klandestino were especially memorable, fueled by the lively energy of the audiences each night.

And as if it wasn't enough. the year closed with two unforgettable editions of Gozadera Social Club at Hoy Como Ayer, nights filled with dancing and live performances of the best Latin classics, all touched with the unique Lotus Collective energy.
2026 awaits with more shows, music, and collective moments. We hope to see you there!
Lotus Collective
Copyright ¬© 2026 Lotus Collective - All Rights Reserved.

secciones.texto: so...where is Edgar?
Suddenly, this era came to an end
AFTER THE BAN OF SOUTH POINT JAMS...
WHAT HAPPENED NEXT? WELL, AFTER EVEN LOSING EDGAR HIMSELF...
THE ONLY THING LEFT... FINDING the perfect team
MEET THE SINGLES OF "WHERE IS EDGAR?"
meet the tracks released with the album
DO YOU WANT Lotus Collective FOR A SHOW OR EVENT?

textos: The iconic South Beach park, one of the best places to catch a sunset and experience the breathtaking views of the City of Miami.
As unreal as it may sound, this was once a jamming spot that not only marked the beginnings of Lotus Collective‚Ä¶
But also marked a chapter of unprecedented creative expression and vibrant connection for both the band and the Miami Beach community.

However, we felt grateful to have finally found a hub for our music. What began as just a few friends playing for fun soon became our way to connect with a welcoming, expansive audience and to meet both local and international musicians.
After several noise complaints from residents in nearby buildings, live performances in the park were permanently banned by the city.
This separated us from the warm community that had embraced us for so long and left us with an emptiness that later was transformed into inspiration for the song that opens our debut album.
That‚Äôs when Edgar appeared! He generously offered us his balcony so we could keep our late-night jam sessions alive.
Became the place where the band‚Äôs best jams took place. Edgar‚Äôs balcony had a special vibe that kept us motivated, even during moments when everything felt like it was falling apart.
Edgar suddenly lost contact with us‚Äîhe vanished. The being who once radiated mystical energy was now nowhere to be found.

A story that involved the iconic music gatherings at South Point Park, the after-hours jam sessions on Edgar‚Äôs balcony, our experiences performing and living around Miami, and, of course, the unforgettable disappearance of our mystical friend, Edgar.
The mind and mentor behind the production of this debut album‚Äîa producer who not only captured our new sound but also chose to feature himself on tracks like Para√≠so and South Point
The recording engineer who carefully selected the right musical equipment at Custom Studios to bring even our wildest visions to life.
The creative mind and artist who made the artwork for all the singles of Where Is Edgar?, including the album cover
The mastering engineer who gave our album a perfectly polished final touch.
A soulful, jazzy heartbreak track with a Latin twist. Inspired by the raw emotions of waiting for a love that never arrived, the track captures the heat of passion and the sting of disappointment.

A fusion of jazz, funk, and tropical rhythms, featuring a special guitar performance by Cheo Pardo, resulting in a groove that captures Miami‚Äôs carefree charm, warm nights, palm trees, and no-pressure love.
A track that was born in one of the band‚Äôs late-night sessions at Miami‚Äôs Lotus House. It's a mix of Latin soul with classic funk and modern jazz. The perfect soundtrack for the nocturnal hours.

With sunny rhythms and a subtle bittersweet reflection, it tells the story of a proud mango tree owner who shares his ‚Äúfruit of gold‚Äù with everyone‚Äîuntil the season ends and people lose interest in him.

Our tribute to all those iconic South Point jams. Featuring again the special participation of Cheo Pardo on guitar, it's a track that captures the vibes of those warm Sundays of live music, sunsets, and cultural connection with the community, and also the funky introduction to te album "Where Is Edgar?"
The most jazzy song on the album, with undeniable funky and disco elements that give it the dreamy atmosphere that inspired the lyrics.
A Latin fusion track for those loves that feel all-consuming and unreciprocated. It closes the album with some sour lyrics and the participation of Fitasha.
Lotus Collective
